newsitem.title: SYRIA: Syria sells Alegria 75,000 tonnes of hard wheat.
newsitem.headline: Syria sells Alegria 75,000 tonnes of hard wheat.

text.p: Syria has sold Algeria 75,000 tonnes of hard amber durum wheat for delivery during the next three months, an official spokesman said on Monday.

The spokesman for Syria's General Establishment for Cereal Processing and Trade (GECPT) told Reuters an agreement to this effect was signed in Algeria by Syrian and Algerian grains officials on Sunday.
He did not disclose any prices but traders said it was close to the western Canadian No.2 red spring wheat price.
The GECPT official said the deal was separate from two other tenders which the establishment issued recently for the sale of 100,000 and 50,000 tonnes of hard amber durum wheat.
Results of the 100,000 tonnes are expected to be announced on October 30 while those of the 50,000 would be made on October 16.
